result.execSummary:
The defendant Alberto R Vallejos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber for work only. Court advises the defendant
any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

miscConds.notes: No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; random screening.
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alberto R Vallejos

records.addlTxt: Letter to Tudi Montejano regarding petition for return of seized property (money)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per order dated March 23, 2017, Appeal No. 2014XX1522-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to May 22, 2017.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction with Huber for work only and 38 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $100 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) maintain employment. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as amended in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the State, Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of Cocaine 961.41(3g)(c) an unclassified misdemeanor.  Court amends the Information to reflect the correct penalties.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Violation Report received and filed with court.

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant appears late.  Parties are still negotiating and defense moves for another change of plea date.  Court vacates the bench warrant and reinstates the bail.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos not in court.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the parties, Court adjourns the change of plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Kevin R Shomin for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State advises the Court police reports were inadvertently provided to defense that do not apply to this case.  Court grants defense motion.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Notice and Motion to Exclude Telephone Information

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Motions to be filed by 4-4-14; response/reply by 4-11-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

14RM007218  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/13/14 vf

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Alberto R Vallejos not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties would like time for investigation.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Alberto R Vallejos in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
